Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2025 #50
Order Adopted as Amended
Mar 17, 2025 5:30 PM

Congratulations to Deborah Mason on her 50th Anniversary of dedication to the arts and dance education in Cambridge

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, PTSponsors:Councillor Paul F. Toner, Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson, Councillor Patricia Nolan, Councillor Burhan Azeem, Councillor Catherine Zusy, Mayor E. Denise Simmons, Councillor Jivan Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern, Councillor Sumbul Siddiqui
Category:Congratulations

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

Deborah Mason, founder and executive director of the Deborah Mason Performing Arts Center (DMPAC), formerly known as the Deborah Mason School of Dance (DMSD), is celebrating 50 years of dedication to the arts and dance education in Cambridge; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Deborah, who grew up in East Cambridge with her parents and 4 siblings, set out on a journey fueled by big dreams and big goals, which would not only be self-fulfilling but also inspire thousands of young people along the way; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

In 1975 Deborah opened her first studio in a small storefront in Inman Square with 115 students, marking the birth of DMSD and its enduring legacy; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Despite the challenges of relocating five times, Deborah’s determination led to growth—not only in the number of students but also in the quality and scope of each new studio, always striving to provide a better experience for her students; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

In 2004, Deborah founded the Cambridge Youth Dance Program (CYDP) a nonprofit, a pre-professional dance company aimed at raising funds for scholarships, uniting the community, breaking barriers and fostering social change through the arts; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

In 2017, The Deborah Mason School of Dance was renamed the Deborah Mason Performing Arts Center (DMPAC) to reflect the expanded growth and the range of disciplines offered at the center; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Deborah has received numerous recognitions for her commitment to the arts, including honors from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, the House of Representatives, and Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, also holding the key to the City of Cambridge for her dedication to the arts, and was cited by the U.S. Senate for providing decades of high-quality arts education; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

In 2023, Deborah was awarded the BDA Dr. Michael Shannon Champion Award, nominated by the dance community and received the Lifetime Achievement Award for her extraordinary contributions to the art form; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

With a vision of providing high-quality dance education, Deborah has remained a committed community activist throughout her career, inspiring generations of dancers. Along with her husband Steve and children Jamie and Steven, Deborah has become a vital part of the community, a dream realized; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Council go on record honoring Deborah Mason for her continued and unwavering leadership and service to the arts community, as well as her lasting legacy as a center of excellence in dance education, and congratulates her on her 50th Anniversary; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and hereby is requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to Deborah Mason on behalf of the entire City Council.

 


 

Meeting History

Mar 17, 2025 5:30 PM  City Council Regular Meeting
RESULT:ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED
